title: Trump-Putin Talks in Alaska End Without Ukraine Ceasefire Agreement
snippets: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are meeting at a military base outside Anchorage, Alaska. We've got the latest.
Three BBC correspondents at the meeting in Alaska assess what we learned about the two leaders and what's next for the war.
Warm welcome for Russia's Putin at meeting with US President Donald Trump in Alaska, but no deal on ending Ukraine war.
Truncated talks end without ceasefire despite US president’s warm welcome for Russian leader

President Trump spoke with Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelensky, who said he would visit Washington on Monday. Mr. Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia offered vague statements about progress after they met.
President Trump’s failure to reach an accord on Ukraine only made his warm welcome for the Russian leader more striking.

President Trump gave President Vladimir Putin a warm public reception, effectively ending his diplomatic isolation over the past three years for his invasion of Ukraine. But Mr. Putin did not agree to stop the war.
titles: Putin and Trump tout 'progress' despite no Ukraine peace deal
No ceasefire, no deal: What summit means for Trump, Putin and Ukraine
Trump, Putin end short summit without ceasefire deal in Ukraine
Trump fails to secure Ukraine deal at Alaska summit with Putin

At Trump’s Summit, No Deal on Ukraine, and No Consequence for Putin
Trump and Putin Put on a Show in Summit, but No Ukraine Deal Emerges
summary: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met at a military base outside Anchorage, Alaska, where they discussed the ongoing war in Ukraine. Despite a warm welcome from Trump, the talks concluded without reaching a ceasefire or any agreement to end the conflict. The meeting ended Trump's diplomatic isolation of Putin over the Ukraine invasion but failed to produce a solid outcome on stopping the war. Additionally, Trump spoke with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky, who plans to visit Washington. The lack of a decisive agreement on Ukraine was noted as a significant aspect of th

title: Trump, Putin End Talks Without Ukraine Deal, Remain Optimistic
snippets: US President Donald Trump says he and Russian President Vladimir Putin made progress during talks in Alaska.
Trump and Putin will meet one-on-one Friday at a historic summit in Alaska. What’s on the table?

summary: During a brief press conference, US President Trump and Russian President Putin did not take questions and did not reach a deal regarding Ukraine. Trump stated, "we didn’t get there … but we have a good chance of getting there," indicating optimism despite the lack of a finalized agreement. He described the meeting as "extremely productive," noting that while many points were agreed upon, a few remain unresolved.

title: Trump Meets Putin in Anchorage, Puts Business on Hold Over Ukraine Conflict
snippets: US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin greeted each other today in Anchorage, Alaska.
President Trump and Russian President Putin arrived in Alaska for their high-stakes summit about the war in Ukraine.
ABC News’ Chief Global Affairs Correspondent Martha Raddatz says the imagery surrounding the summit is “devastating” to watch for Ukrainians.
“That was a very friendly welcome,” ABC News' Chief White House correspondent Mary Bruce tells David Muir.
"Trump wants to exhaust all options to have a peaceful end to war," the White House said in advance of his meeting with Vladimir Putin.

The West has long sought to make Vladimir Putin a pariah over the bloodshed in Ukraine. But on Friday, the Russian leader will break out of international isolation and step foot on U.S. soil, welcomed by an American president eager to fulfill his promise of stopping the war. Trump expressed a willingness to engage in business discussions with Putin but emphasized that no deals would be made until the conflict in Ukraine is resolved. The White House indicated that while major agreements were unlikely at this meeting, Trump aimed to explore all options for a peaceful end to the war. title: Liverpool Wins 4-2 Against Bournemouth Amid Tributes and Racial Abuse Report
snippets: Liverpool begin their Premier League title defence with a win but needed late goals to beat Bournemouth on a night dedicated to former player Diogo Jota.
Bournemouth fight back from two down but Liverpool secure late win on emotional Anfield night.
In Liverpool's first Premier League match since Diogo Jota's tragic death, late goals from Federico Chiesa and Mohamed Salah sealed victory in an opening match to remember.

Defending champion Liverpool launched the Premier League with a dramatic 4-2 win over Bournemouth at Anfield on Friday in an emotionally charged match featuring tributes to Diogo Jota and a player reporting racial abuse.
titles: Liverpool leave it late to beat Bournemouth in six-goal thriller
Liverpool avoid late Bournemouth scare to win Premier League opener

summary: Liverpool began their Premier League title defence with a 4-2 victory over Bournemouth at Anfield, in a match marked by tributes to former player Diogo Jota. The game, which was emotionally charged, saw Liverpool secure the win with late goals from Federico Chiesa and Mohamed Salah. The night was also notable for an incident of a player reporting racial abuse.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Strike, 600+ Flights Canceled Amid Wage Dispute
snippets: The employees are demanding, in part, wage parity with smaller domestic airlines, a union spokesman said. More than 600 flights have been canceled.
Ahead of the work stoppage, the airline said it had canceled most of the 700 flights that it directly operates, which carry about 130,000 people each day.

Air Canada’s 10,500 flight attendants went on strike Saturday, grounding hundreds of flights and disrupting 130,000 passengers per day at the peak of holiday season after pay negotiations fell through.

The union representing more than 10,000 Air Canada flight attendants says its members have walked off the job after it was unable to reach an eleventh hour deal with the airline. The strike officially began just before 1 a.m. ET on Saturday. The airline said all Air Canada and Air Canada Rouge fligh

titles: Air Canada cancels hundreds of flights as attendants go on strike

summary: Air Canada's 10,500 flight attendants initiated a strike on Saturday, leading to the cancellation of over 600 flights and affecting around 130,000 passengers daily during the holiday peak season. This action came after failed wage negotiations between the airline and the union, which sought parity with smaller domestic airlines. The strike began just before 1 a.m. ET, impacting all Air Canada and Air Canada Rouge flights.

title: Cloudburst in Pakistan and India Causes Flash Floods, 185 Dead
snippets: The majority of deaths were recorded in Pakistan's mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area.

Search for the missing continues in north-west after downpour also sparks deadly flooding and landslides in India

A massive cloudburst has triggered flash floods in north-west Pakistan, killing at least 157 people, as rescuers continued to search for people missing after floods in neighbour
The country has endured heavier rain during monsoon seasons, which scientists have attributed to climate change. The authorities said that at least 194 people died on Friday.
titles: Flash floods kill more than 300 in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir
Flash floods kill at least 159 people in Pakistan after huge cloudburst
Flash Floods in Pakistan Kill at Least 150 People in a Single Day
summary: A massive cloudburst in north-west Pakistan has resulted in flash floods, killing at least 157 people, with the majority of fatalities occurring in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area. The incident also caused deadly flooding and landslides in neighboring India. Rescue operations are ongoing for those still missing. The region has experienced heavier monsoon rains, which scientists link to climate change. The total death toll reported by authorities on Friday reached at least 185.

This series of events highlights ongoing international tensions and the complex dynamics of US-Russia-Ukraine relations.

title: Alejandro Kirk Shines, Leads Blue Jays to Victory Over Rangers
snippets: Alejandro Kirk's late-game heroics resulted in three deafening ovations from the 42,260 inside the Rogers Centre on Friday.
When Alejandro Kirk steals a base, you know things are going well for the Toronto Blue Jays.

Watch as Alejandro Kirk brings Toronto Blue Jays fans to their feet, slicing a go-ahead two-run single off of Texas Rangers reliever Phil Maton, then picking up his first career stolen base in the same inning.
titles: Kirk plays hero, steals first base in Jays’ win
Blue Jays’ Alejandro Kirk records first career stolen base in dramatic win
Blue Jays’ Kirk slashes go-ahead single, then earns first career steal
summary: Alejandro Kirk led the Toronto Blue Jays to a thrilling moment against the Texas Rangers, drawing three loud ovations from 42,260 fans at the Rogers Centre. Kirk's performance included a pivotal two-run single off Rangers reliever Phil Maton, giving the Blue Jays a lead. Additionally, he achieved his first career stolen base during the same inning, highlighting a standout game that significantly contributed to the team's success on that day.

title: Kirk Powers Blue Jays to Comeback Win; Yelich, Chisholm Shine in MLB Victories
snippets: Alejandro Kirk followed a two-run homer in the seventh inning with a game-winning two-run single in the eighth to push the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-5 comeback win in the series opener against the Texas Rangers on Friday.
Alejandro Kirk mashed a two-run homer, then ripped a go-ahead two-run single to lead the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-5 comeback win over the Texas Rangers.
After falling behind by seven runs early, Christian Yelich led the way for the Milwaukee Brewers with four hits, two home runs and five RBIs to pull off a 10-8 comeback win over the Cincinnati Reds.

Jazz Chisholm crushed a two-run shot for his 21st homer of the season to lead the New York Yankees to a 4-3 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals. Luis Gil conceded one run over five and one-third innings to earn the win on the mound.

Lucas Giolito struck out five through 6 1/3 innings while allowing just one run and Trevor Storey hit a walk-off single in the ninth inning to lead the Boston Red Sox to a 2-1 victory over the Miami Marlins.

Charlie Morton gave up just two hits over six innings of work while striking out five to lead the Detroit Tigers to a 7-0 shutout victory over the Minnesota Twins. Dillon Dingler led the charge on offence, posting two hits and three RBIs in the win.
Cal Raleigh and Mitch Garver each homered while Cole Young finished with three hits and three RBIs to elevate the Seattle Mariners to an 11-9 victory over the New York Mets.

Despite Brandon Young’s bid for perfection falling through in the eighth, the Baltimore Orioles shut out the Houston Astros 7-0. Coby Mayo and Dylan Carlson aided on offence, each belting their fifth home run of the season in the win.
Kyle Schwarber and Bryce Harper each crushed homers to lift the Philadelphia Phillies to a 6-2 win over the Washington Nationals.
Clayton Kershaw pitched six innings allowing just one run on two hits while Teoscar Hernandez hit a solo homer to elevate the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 3-2 victory over the San Diego Padres.
Braxton Ashcraft tossed five innings of one-run ball and struck out four while Jack Suwinski hit a solo homer to lead the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 3-2 win over the Chicago Cubs.
After Kansas City Royals’ Salvador Perez swatted a go-ahead homer in the fourth, Adam Frazier added an insurance run in the sixth to solidify an eventual 3-1 win over the Chicago White Sox.
Hurston Waldrep pitched six scoreless innings while Nacho Alvarez Jr. and Michael Harris II each drove in a run to give the Atlanta Braves a 2-0 victory over the Cleveland Guardians.
Nick Kurtz and Colby Thomas each had a home run and three RBIs while Shea Langeliers also went yard and drove in two RBIs as the Athletics dominated the Los Angeles Angels 10-3.
Junior Caminero hit a solo homer while Josh Lowe and Chandler Simpson each drove in two runs to lead the Tampa Bay Rays to a 7-6 victory over the San Francisco Giants.
titles: Kirk’s heroics lift Blue Jays past Rangers 6-5
MLB Highlights: Blue Jays 6, Rangers 5
MLB Highlights: Brewers 10, Reds 8
MLB Highlights: Yankees 4, Cardinals 3
MLB Highlights: Red Sox 2, Marlins 1

summary: Alejandro Kirk led the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-5 comeback win against the Texas Rangers with a two-run homer and a game-winning two-run single. In other games, Christian Yelich's performance helped the Milwaukee Brewers overcome the Cincinnati Reds 10-8, while Jazz Chisholm's 21st homer contributed to the New York Yankees' 4-3 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals. The Boston Red Sox, Detroit Tigers, Seattle Mariners, Baltimore Orioles, Philadelphia Phillies, Los Angeles Dodgers, Pittsburgh Pirates, Kansas City Royals, Atlanta Braves, Athletics, and Tampa Bay Rays also secured wins in their re

title: Kelsey Plum Says Controversial Team Clark Remarks Were "A Bad Joke"
snippets: Sparks guard Kelsey Plum said Friday on Sue Bird's podcast that her remarks after the All-Star Game about members of Team Clark not being present for the "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirt meeting were "a really bad joke" about the players being hungover.

summary: Kelsey Plum, a guard for the Sparks, clarified on Sue Bird's podcast that her previous comments about Team Clark members missing a meeting for "Pay Us What You Owe Us" T-shirts were meant as a joke, suggesting they were hungover. Her initial remarks had caused controversy. Plum now describes those comments as "a really bad joke."

title: Brewers Tie Club Record with 13th Straight Win, Rally Past Reds 10-8
snippets: The Brewers rallied from seven runs down through two innings Friday night by scoring nine unanswered runs in thumping the Cincinnati Reds 10-8.

Christian Yelich had two homers among his four hits and drove in five runs as the Milwaukee Brewers overcame a seven-run deficit to beat the Cincinnati Reds 10-8 Friday night for their club record-tying 13th straight victory.
titles: A special win: How the Brewers tied their franchise record with 13 straight victories
MLB-best Brewers rally past Reds, tie club record with 13th straight win
summary: The Milwaukee Brewers achieved a club record-tying 13th consecutive victory by overcoming a seven-run deficit to defeat the Cincinnati Reds 10-8. Christian Yelich led the comeback with two home runs among his four hits, contributing five RBIs, as the Brewers scored nine unanswered runs after being down early in the game.

title: Scientists Discover Martian Rock, Hint at Organic Origins
snippets: A curious red Martian rock nicknamed Sapphire Canyon has scientists excited, as its spotted appearance hints at possible organic origins. On Earth, researchers tested a powerful laser technique, O-PTIR, on a similar rock found by chance in Arizona, proving it can rapidly and precisely reveal a mater
titles: Strange spotted rock on Mars could reveal signs of ancient life
This Martian Rock’s Mysterious Spots May Reveal Clues to Ancient Life
summary: Scientists have discovered a red Martian rock named Sapphire Canyon, which features unique spots suggesting potential organic origins. Utilizing a powerful laser technique called O-PTIR, researchers successfully analyzed a similar rock from Arizona on Earth, demonstrating the method's ability to quickly and accurately identify materials. This breakthrough has heightened interest in Sapphire Canyon, as it may offer new insights into ancient life on Mars.

snippets: Elon Musk's SpaceX announced Friday that its Starship megarocket is scheduled to blast off on a new test flight next weekend after recent attempts have ended in fiery explosions.
titles: After repeated explosions, new test for Musk's megarocket
summary: SpaceX, led by Elon Musk, plans to launch its Starship megarocket on a test flight next weekend following previous failed attempts resulting in explosions. The upcoming test aims to further develop the spacecraft's capabilities.

title: Human Activity Alters Great Salt Lake's State First Time in 2,000 Years
snippets: Over the past 8,000 years, Utah's Great Salt Lake has been sensitive to changes in climate and water inflow. Now, new sediment isotope data indicate that human activity over the past 200 years has pushed the lake into a biogeochemical state not seen for at least 2,000 years.
titles: The 8,000-year history recorded in Great Salt Lake sediments
summary: Recent research using sediment isotope data reveals that human activity over the last 200 years has significantly altered the biogeochemical state of Utah's Great Salt Lake, pushing it into a condition not observed in at least 2,000 years. This change is attributed to the lake's sensitivity to climate shifts and water inflow alterations over millennia.

title: Rice University Finds Active Flat Bands in Kagome Superconductors
snippets: Researchers at Rice University and collaborating institutions have discovered direct evidence of active flat electronic bands in a kagome superconductor. This breakthrough could pave the way for new methods to design quantum materials—including superconductors, topological insulators and spin-based
titles: Scientists find new quantum behavior in unusual superconducting material
summary: Researchers at Rice University, along with other institutions, have found direct evidence of active flat electronic bands in a kagome superconductor. This discovery is significant for the potential development of new quantum materials, such as superconductors, topological insulators, and spin-based electronics. This advancement opens up new possibilities for designing materials with unique electronic properties.

title: "Scientists Uncover 'Spiraling Symphony' in Black Hole Vibrations"
titles: Scientists Uncover the Spiraling Symphony Hidden in Black Hole Vibrations
summary: Scientists have discovered a complex pattern of vibrations emanating from black holes, likened to a spiraling symphony. This finding, derived from analyzing the gravitational waves produced when two black holes merge, reveals intricate oscillations that could provide deeper insights into the fundamental properties of black holes and the nature of gravity. This research marks a significant step in understanding the dynamics of black hole mergers and the resulting gravitational waves.

title: Climate Change Tied to Rising Violent Conflicts, Study Finds
snippets: The pathway from climate change to violent conflict is not simple. There are the obvious immediate effects of global warming like water scarcity and crop failure. But beyond these, climate stress can pave the road to violence through indirect channels—a gradual rise in food insecurity and growing so
titles: Child malnutrition is a sign of conflict to come: Nigerian study links climate change, food and violence
summary: Climate change is linked to increasing violent conflict through both direct and indirect effects. Direct consequences such as water scarcity and crop failure are clear. Indirectly, climate change contributes to violence by causing a gradual rise in food insecurity, which can exacerbate tensions and lead to conflict. This connection highlights the complex relationship between environmental stressors and societal stability.

title: ASU Develops NasRED: Rapid Test Detects COVID, Ebola, HIV from a Blood Drop
snippets: Arizona State University scientists have unveiled NasRED, a revolutionary one-drop blood test that can detect diseases like COVID-19, Ebola, HIV, and Lyme with incredible speed and precision. Using gold nanoparticles to spot microscopic disease markers, the device delivers results in just 15 minutes
titles: A $2 gold nanotech test that detects deadly diseases in minutes
summary: Arizona State University scientists have developed NasRED, a groundbreaking blood test capable of detecting diseases such as COVID-19, Ebola, HIV, and Lyme disease quickly and accurately. This innovative test, which requires just a single drop of blood, utilizes gold nanoparticles to identify tiny disease markers, providing results in as little as 15 minutes.
